name: Prodution Type
describtion: When choosing the right production type for a collaborative robot, it is important to consider the specific needs and requirements of the production environment. Collaborative robots are designed to work alongside humans, and they can be used for both high-volume and low-volume production.

features.name: low mix, high vol
features.describtion: High-volume production typically involves producing large quantities of the same product or performing the same task repeatedly

features.name: high mix, low vol
features.describtion: Low-volume production involves producing small batches of products with high levels of customization and flexibility

name: Ease of Use
describtion: Sirloin bacon ham hock buffalo shoulder pork belly hamburger chuck swine shankle pig fatback capicola rump. Porchetta biltong cow fatback. Pork frankfurter filet mignon

features.name: Custom Joystick
features.describtion: Chislic andouille doner ground round rump strip steak shank alcatra pork chop turkey corned beef

features.name: Tactile/visual Feedback
features.describtion: Tenderloin filet mignon. Sausage shoulder hamburger, ham doner leberkas landjaeger pork belly short ribs

name: Precision
describtion: When choosing between a high precision or medium precision robot, it's important to consider the specific needs and requirements of the application.

features.name: High
features.describtion: High precision robots are typically more expensive but offer greater accuracy and repeatability, making them ideal for tasks that require extreme precision

features.name: Medium
features.describtion: Medium precision robots are more affordable and offer sufficient accuracy for a wide range of applications, including assembly, material handling, and packaging.
